title: Human-Centric Evaluation of LLMs in Software Development
description: Examine the usability of LLMs in software development tasks, focusing on human-LLM interaction and task efficiency.
motivation: While LLMs are increasingly used in software development, their impact on human efficiency and task completion remains unclear. A human-centric evaluation can provide insights into optimizing these interactions.
milestones: Define research objectives and formulate hypotheses.
Conduct a literature review on LLMs and their applications in software development.
Design a research methodology prioritizing human-LLM interaction.
Develop a prototype LLM integration for software development tasks.
Prepare ethical guidelines and obtain necessary approvals for the study.
Recruit participants from diverse software development backgrounds.
Conduct preliminary trials with the prototype.
Collect and analyze data from initial trials to refine the methodology.
Execute the main study with the refined methodology.
Gather and analyze data focusing on task efficiency and user interaction.
Prepare a comprehensive report of findings and insights.
Publish results in a peer-reviewed journal and present at a relevant conference.

timeline.Week 19-20: Analyze data from the main study.
